title: Black Swan Sundays at The Raven Tower
address: 310 North St Houston, TX 77009 United States
body: Bring a mat, towel, water, and friends to start your Sunday off right with a free outdoor yoga class hosted by Black Swan Yoga at Raven Tower. Each Sunday will feature a different yoga instructor. Admission No cover.

title: Texas Ink & Art Expo in Galveston
address: 5600 Seawall Blvd Houston , TX 77554 United States
body: Ink lovers unite at this 3-day Tattoo Expo that will include live tattooing, tattoo art, contests, and even a freak show at the Galveston Island Convention Center. Admission Tickets are $20 per day or $35 for a 3-day pass.

title: October Urban Harvest Farmers Market at Saint Arnold Brewing Co.
address: 2000 Lyons Ave Houston, TX 77020 United States
body: The Urban Harvest Farmers Market brings delicious local food vendors to our the Saint Arnold Brewery. Shop anything from baked goods to cheeses to prepared foods. Admission No cover.

title: Houston Texans vs. Tennessee Titans at NRG Stadium
address: Reliant Pkwy Houston, TX 77054 United States
body: Get loud for the Texans as they play against the Tennessee Titans on their home turf at NRG Stadium. Admission Tickets range for as low as $46 and upwards of $350.

title: 16th Annual Village Art Car Show at Traders Village
address: 7979 N Eldridge Pkwy Houston, TX 77041 United States
body: See more than 75 vehicles of all sorts painted, pasted and carved into artistic masterpieces on wheels, as Traders Village welcomes the Houston Art Car Klub for the 16th Annual Art Car Show. Meet the artists, jam out to live music, and break out the camera to snap pics next to these unique cars. Admission: No cover. Parking is $4.

title: Houston Biker Fest 2017
address: 9906 Gulf Freeway Houston , TX 77034 United States
body: Houston Biker Fest is a festival created for all bikers to promote unity, embrace diversity and to preserve the biker tradition for future generations. Held at Hobby Event Center alongside I-45 in Southeast Houston, Houston Biker Fest will feature bike exhibits, a bike competition, live music, merchandise and food vendors, and more. Tickets are $15 in advance; $20 at the door.

title: HPA Cat Fest 2017 at Pearl Bar
address: 4216 Washington Avenue Houston, TX 77007 United States
body: Head to the Pearl Bar for adoptable cats on site, information about Houston Pets Alive programs and raffle items. Admission No cover.

title: BCO Graffiti Art & Bike Ride at Market Square Park
address: 301 Milam St Houston, TX 77002 United States
body: Check out the outdoor street art adorning the city during this bike ride where you'll meet at Market Street Park. Admission Free to attend, but you must RSVP. Bikes will be available to rent.

title: Hip Hop Flea Market
address: 2011 Leeland St. Houston, Texas 77003 United States
body: Harvey may have stopped the first Hip Hop Flea Market, but this Sunday, not only is it on like Donkey Kong, the vintage market will close the Bgirl City Weekend, a three-day celebration of the ladies of hip hop, from female DJs to graffiti artists. So now you can peruse the selection of ‘80s and ‘90s throwback gear while also seeing live battles, listening to great music and – for the brave – participating in free toprock or breaking workshops. Saint Arnold is bringing enough beer for everyone, and if you get hungry, Popston, Planet Churro and Boombox Taco have you covered. Admission: Free.

title: Erick Morillo at Clé Houston
address: 2301 Main St Houston, TX 77002 United States
body: DJ and producer Erick Morillo spins music at Clé Houston lounge in Midtown. Fashionable poolside attire is required. Admission Tickets are $20.

title: A Night for Houston’s Community: Harvey Relief at Avant Garden
address: 411 Westheimer Rd Houston, TX 77006 United States
body: Space Montrose, a store that specializes in selling locally made items, hosts an art market where 100% of the proceeds will go to Hurricane Harvey victims. Expect live music, art, food, and drinks. Admission No cover.

title: Miami Vice Sunday Funday at Henke & Pillot Houston
address: 809 Congress Avenue Houston, TX 77002 United States
body: Spend your Sunday Funday having drinks and brunch as DJ Johnny Mac spins Miami style beats at Henke & Pillot Houston. Admission No cover.

title: Father John Misty in Concert at White Oak Music Hall
address: 2915 N Main Street Houston, TX 77009 United States
body: See the singer-songwriter Father John Misty perform songs off of his new record Pure Comedy at White Oak Music Hall. Admission Tickets start at $35.

title: Max Frost at The House of Blues
address: 1204 Caroline St. Houston, TX 77002 United States
body: Watch the Artist Max Frost perform live at the House of Blues.

title: Zoogma at Last Concert Cafe
address: 1403 Nance St Houston, TX 77002 United States
body: Zoogma will be performing at Last Concert Cafe.

title: PVRIS at Warehouse Live
address: 813 St. Emanuel Houston, TX 77003 United States
body: Come watch PVRIS Live at Warehouse Live. Tickets start at $25.

title: Songwriter Sundays at Dean’s Downtown
address: 316 Main St Houston, TX United States
body: Spend your Sunday relaxing and listening to music by local singer songwriters at Dean's Downtown. Admission: No cover charge.
